comments.commentBody:
The swamp will stop at nothing to prevent it's drainage.

Maybe Trump should do what Obama did when investigations of his misdeeds arose. Hire a major campaign bundler as the investigator. It worked - Obama was innocent every time. Interesting how that works
Two words: do-over.

I'm sorry, but when you have an ex president doing all he can to undermine a current president, that is not only in horribly poor taste, but it is also extremely detrimental to the country. Who has the thin skin? YES, trump was a dickhead to Obama with the birther deal, BUT, we all know that it wasn't racial, it was tactical...but for Obama to now be vindictive? Well, that is the TRUE measure of this man so many will go to any lengths to fawn over.

And where was the media for the last 8 yrs??? All of a sudden they've found their raison d'etre again? When there were several very very real scandals taking place, the media COLLUDED with Obama to dismiss it...COLLUDED to squelch stories...I mean, its really disgusting what took place and what is now taking place...SHAME on the media.

Might the 500 Billion dollar deal our oil companies want to cut with Russia have something to do with this?  Drop sanctions against Russia and get the deal.  Shouldn't that be enough payoff to Putin?  I fear Trump talking about ending our NATO agreements is also part of the deal, which means goodbye free Baltic states as Russia consumes them along with Ukraine and Crimea and wherever the 800 pound Bear wishes to go.
This is only the beginning of a series of Trump scandals. Nobody is even talking about all the conflicts of interest he has due to dubious business ties.

Evidence of crimes but not enough time to prosecute, and KNOWING the incoming administration would grossly abuse power and obstruct justice.

This is WAY bigger than Watergate.

Trump will be gone within the first 90 days. Why? We haven't even started to investigate the conflict of interest scandals. Once his base starts to wonder what they have done, Trump will go off the deep end (become unhinged), especially when Congress says they cannot fund any of what he wants. He won't be impeached, but he will be removed for being unfit to serve as President. Let's hope he has fake nuclear codes.

Why are Republicans so reluctant to call in a Independent Prosecutor?
Why are some Republicans in the House asking that DJT's income tax returns be sealed?
Why aren't Republicans concerned about the Russian hacking into our elections..and with the Russian/Putin connection?
Why are they putting party over Country First?

This is so depressing that we have one of our political parties so willing to turn a blind eye to a foreign hostile country, just so they can maintain their agenda.

So disturbing in so many ways. On the one hand, we know the Russians are adept and cyberattacks and have a history of interference in elections.

But there is also something so very disturbing about seeding the government, with an army of potential leakers ready at any moment to anonymously release unverifiable accusations against a new administration whose policies they - and frankly I - dislike.

Coincidences do happen, but the timing of new anonymous revelations hew so closely to either the implementation of policies the previous administration would oppose - the Justice Department backing out of the Texas Voter case and no longer supporting the idea that it was a deliberate attempt to disenfranchise minority voters and Mr. Sessions announcement that the Justice Department would halt its investigations of police departments- coupled with President Trump's well received speech and suddenly their are new revelations about Jeff Sessions and we are all talking about Russian collusion and the Trump campaign again.

But, no one has seen any actual intelligence and we have no report from the FBI on their investigation. It's all just anonymous leaks.

As with the end to filibusters for judicial appointments apart from Supreme Court justices, we may come to regret support for this new government based Wikkileaks operation. I'm just uncomfortable. It has a Joseph McCarthy feel to it.

This new President Trump isn't a statesman, a thoughtful man of substance or anything of the sort, instead we have a Carnival Huckster, a P.T. Barnum in disguise and not anything close to a President.

It is embarrassing to watch someone, this Huckster with such a big mouth and ego, who is always pointing the finger of blame at everyone else and shows himself to be an empty suit who is in way over his head in the oval office.
Very smart move. It puts conspiracy theories to rest.

Always amazed at how many college educated people who think they are very smart, are the easiest people conned!
Never suspecting the MSM and the deep state are colluding behind the scenes!
Why would ANY of you believe this given this admission from the past.

“We are grateful to the Washington Post, The New York Times, Time Magazine and other great publications whose directors have attended our meetings and respected their promises of discretion for almost forty years. It would have been impossible for us to develop our plan for the world if we had been subjected to the lights of publicity during those years. But, the world is now more sophisticated and prepared to march towards a world government. The supranational sovereignty of an intellectual elite and world bankers is surely preferable to the national auto-determination practiced in past centuries.”
—David Rockefeller, Baden-Baden, Germany 1991

Orchestrated and manipulated world. Do you like letting rich elites control things from behind the scenes? Manipulate your media and control your information? Neither do the rest of America which is why we went against the elites and media and elected Trump!

If not for the "gang who couldn't shoot straight" behavior of the Trump people, this story would have been the biggest news of the week.   The actions of Obama administration political appointees on the white house staff/national security council remind one of the Nixon white house staff before and during Watergate.  I just visited the newly reopened Nixon library last weekend and the Watergate section was a truly sobering and depressing experience and, based on today's NYT article, at least a small part of that sordid history appears to be repeating itself.
Micheal Lewis....  please get to work on this!
The truth will come out. This is America, The world is watching, and they want to see how we handle this mess. I hope the right way.

Articles based on anonymous officials should not be trusted. Who are they? Why should I trust they don't have a political agenda? Clearly, they do.

This nicely illustrates they media 'swamp' that needs draining. And they are at war to preserve themselves.

If I were Trump, I would make it my top priority to prosecute officials who leak classified information to the media. Meanwhile, public should discount all news based on anonymous classified government sources.

The stock market soared yesterday because the coup-ists among H. Clinton, Obama etc are perceived to be on the wane. These people dislike the USA and have contempt for citizens. They view the government and other world organizations as organs to be used to support their person extracurricular social and financial activities.

We are in a civil war. Disloyal elites, who detest the American electoral system and the American voters generally, are attempting a coup to take over the USA and reassert their global dominance.
Trump vowed to "drain the swamp". Instead, other than himself as the most scurrilous, he is filling the swamp with the likes of Jeff Sessions.
I guess Trump couldn't nominate Ivan Drago for anything,..for it would be too obvious.

replies.commentBody: Mr. Felt is currently spinning in his grave.

comments.commentBody: Where is Deepthroat, now that we so desperately need him?

Civil servants and government officials saw this nightmare administration coming. All these leaks, and now this story, are what I call "SOS."
There are still true Americans in Washington DC.
